member.name: M:Doli.DoPE10.DoPE.CheckApi(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.param: DoPENet version the user wants to use
member.returns: DoPE.ERR.NOERROR: The version check has been successfully finished. DoPE.ERR.INTERNAL: An internal error has occured. DoPE.ERR.VERSION: Means, that either - the application's version does not match to the DoPENet.dll version or - the DoPENet.dll version does not match to the DoPE.dll version

member.name: M:Doli.DoPE10.DoPE.CheckApi(System.String)
member.summary: Unlocks the DoPE .NET library. The stated DoPE version string is checked for equality against: - the DoPE .NET library - the DoPE C++ library (which is used by the DoPE .NET library) If these versions are equal, all library functions can be used.
member.param: The DoPE .NET library version your application wants to work with. Please provide the string in this format: "major-version-number.minor-version-number" Example: "2.70"
member.returns: DoPE.ERR.NOERROR: The version check has been successfully finished. DoPE.ERR.INTERNAL: An internal error has occured. DoPE.ERR.VERSION: Means, that either - the application's version does not match to the DoPENet.dll version or - the DoPENet.dll version does not match to the DoPE.dll version
member.remarks: The version check ensures that your application will only work with both DoPE libraries your application has been designed for.

member.name: T:Doli.DoPE10.DoPE.CMC_ID
member.summary:
Constants for Calculated Sensor Init Value
The formula and used sensor are all coded in a 16Bit value: 1. For formula 0 - 6 may use three sensors: S3 S2 S1 Formula Sign ___________ ___________ ___________ ________ __ 15 14 13 12 11 10 09 08 07 06 05 04 03 02 01 00
2. For formula 7 - 23 Bits 1-3 must be "1" and the formula is in Bits 12 - 15 These extented formulas can only use two Sensors, or the sensors must be in in ascending order ExtFormula S2 S1 Value 7 Sign ___________ ___________ ___________ ________ __ 15 14 13 12 11 10 09 08 07 06 05 04 03 02 01 00

member.name: F:Doli.DoPE10.DoPE.CMC_ID.S1PlusS2PlusS3PlusS4_quarter
member.summary: Sensors must be in in ascending order starting at S1 !! S = (((S1 + S2+ S3+ S4) / 4) / Corr) - Offset

member.name: F:Doli.DoPE10.DoPE.CMC_ID.F_S1PlusS2PlusS3PlusS4
member.summary: Sensors must be in in ascending order starting at S1 !! S = ((S1 + S2+ S3+ S4) / Corr) - Offset

member.name: T:Doli.DoPE10.DoPEcmc
member.summary: PC-EDC interface calculated measuring channels and peak value handling

member.name: M:Doli.DoPE10.DoPEcmc.ConfPeakValue(Doli.DoPE10.DoPE.SENSOR,Doli.DoPE10.DoPE.SENSOR,Doli.DoPE10.DoPE.PEAK_VALUE)
member.summary: Configure peakvalues to measuring data record. The peak values are detected by the EDC. They may be transmitted to PC instead of an unused measuring channel. With this command a peak value of a measuring channel may be configured to a measuring channel in the data record. The peak value detection is available for cyclic commands only. The peak values are refreshed ater each cycle. This command should not be used when DoPEExts2 or DoPEFDPoti command is running.
member.param: Position of the Min/Max value in the measuring data record

member.name: M:Doli.DoPE10.DoPEilc.PcCmd(Doli.DoPE10.DoPE.PC_CMD_EXECUTE,Doli.DoPE10.DoPE.CTRL,Doli.DoPE10.DoPE.PC_CMD_MODE,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Int32,System.Int32,Doli.DoPE10.DoPE.PcCmdData[],System.Int16@)
member.summary: Transfer PC Command data to the EDC and initiate execution.
member.param: Execution mode DoPE.PC_CMD_EXECUTE.LAST Execute completely stored sequence. DoPE.PC_CMD_EXECUTE.APPEND Execute stored sequence, more data will come DoPE.PC_CMD_EXECUTE.PAUSE Fadeout and wait for continue DoPE.PC_CMD_EXECUTE.CONTINUE Fadein and continue interrupted sequence DoPE.PC_CMD_EXECUTE.TERMINATE Terminate a running sequence, (fadeout and stop)

Interpolation mode between the values DoPE.PC_CMD_MODE.POS Command data are position values for each control loop cycle DoPE.PC_CMD_MODE.POS_LINEAR Command data are time and position. A linear function is interpolated between the position values DoPE.PC_CMD_MODE.POS_COSINE Command data are time and position. A cosine function is interpolated between the position values
Pointer to PcCmdData array In DoPE.PC_CMD_MODE.POS the time values will be ignored

member.name: M:Doli.DoPE10.DoPEilc.PcCmdFromFile(Doli.DoPE10.DoPE.CTRL,Doli.DoPE10.DoPE.PC_CMD_MODE,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String,System.Int16@)
member.summary: Transfer PC Command data from a file to the EDC and initiate execution.
member.param: Interpolation mode between the values DoPE.PC_CMD_MODE.POS Command data are position values for each control loop cycle DoPE.PC_CMD_MODE.POS_LINEAR Command data are time and position. A linear function is interpolated between the position values DoPE.PC_CMD_MODE.POS_COSINE Command data are time and position. A cosine function is interpolated between the position values
Column number of StimulationSignal In interpolation modes Time has always column number 0

Pointer to file name and path Supported file types: .csv "Comma Separated Values" text file: Value separator must be ';' Decimal point can be '.' or ',' Lines NOT starting with a number or a separator will be skipped .bmv "DOLI Binary Measured Values" file In DoPE.PC_CMD_MODE.POS the time values will be ignored

member.name: M:Doli.DoPE10.DoPEilc.CalculatePcCmd(Doli.DoPE10.DoPE.PC_CMD_EXECUTE,Doli.DoPE10.DoPE.PC_CMD_MODE,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Int32,System.Int32,Doli.DoPE10.DoPE.PcCmdData[],System.Double,System.Int32,System.Int32@,Doli.DoPE10.DoPE.PcCmdData[]@)
member.summary: Calculate a digital command for each control loop cycle without execution.
member.param: Execution mode DoPE.PC_CMD_EXECUTE.LAST Execute completely stored sequence. DoPE.PC_CMD_EXECUTE.APPEND Execute stored sequence, more data will come DoPE.PC_CMD_EXECUTE.PAUSE Fadeout and wait for continue DoPE.PC_CMD_EXECUTE.CONTINUE Fadein and continue interrupted sequence DoPE.PC_CMD_EXECUTE.TERMINATE Terminate a running sequence, (fadeout and stop)

Interpolation mode between the values DoPE.PC_CMD_MODE.POS Command data are position values for each control loop cycle DoPE.PC_CMD_MODE.POS_LINEAR Command data are time and position. A linear function is interpolated between the position values DoPE.PC_CMD_MODE.POS_COSINE Command data are time and position. A cosine function is interpolated between the position values
Pointer to PcCmdData array In DoPE.PC_CMD_MODE.POS the time values will be ignored
Maximum number of PcCmdData items in OutData array
Pointer to number of valid PcCmdData items in OutData array

member.name: M:Doli.DoPE10.DoPEilc.CalculatePcCmdFromFile(Doli.DoPE10.DoPE.PC_CMD_MODE,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String,System.Double,System.String)
member.summary: Calculate a digital command stored in a file for each control loop cycle without execution. The command creates a new csv output file. The size of this file is limited to 2 GB. If the limit is reached the function returns DoPERR_NOMEM.
member.param: Interpolation mode between the values DoPE.PC_CMD_MODE.POS Command data are position values for each control loop cycle DoPE.PC_CMD_MODE.POS_LINEAR Command data are time and position. A linear function is interpolated between the position values DoPE.PC_CMD_MODE.POS_COSINE Command data are time and position. A cosine function is interpolated between the position values
Column number of StimulationSignal In interpolation modes Time has always column number 0

Pointer to input file name and path Supported file types: .csv "Comma Separated Values" text file: Value separator must be ';' Decimal point can be '.' or ',' Lines NOT starting with a number or a separator will be skipped .bmv "DOLI Binary Measured Values" file In DoPE.PC_CMD_MODE.POS the time values will be ignored

Pointer to output file name and path Supported file types: The file type should be csv (otherwise .csv will be appended to the file name). Each line contains the time and command value separated by ‘;’ with ‘.’ as decimal point. E.g: "0,0708;-9,62E-04"

member.param: true: set all keyboards to the Locked state - all keys are disabled - the Link LED is off false: In DoPEGeneralData RmcActiveMode Single Mode - set all keyboards to the Idle state - only the Link key is enabled - the Link LED is blinking In DoPEGeneralData RmcActiveMode Multi Mode - set all keyboards to the Linked state - all keys are enabled - the Link LED is on

member.returns: The key code of a pressed key or DoPE_KEY_NONE

member.remarks: FUNCTION NOT AVAILABLE for EDC 5 / 25 and EDC 100 !! Use instead of : DoPEPosG1, DoPEPosG2, DoPEPosD1, DoPEPosD2 !!

member.summary: Change control mode and continue movement in the new control mode with the actual speed.

member.name: M:Doli.DoPE10.DoPEmove.Ext2Ctrl(Doli.DoPE10.DoPE.CTRL,System.Double,Doli.DoPE10.DoPE.SENSOR,System.Double,Doli.DoPE10.DoPE.EXT,System.Double,System.Int16@)
member.summary: Move crosshead according to an external command signal. This command works not properly when DoPEConfPeekValue or one of the DoPEConfCMc commands are used.
member.param: Sensor number for the external command signal
various position or speed control modes
Scaling factor for external command signal

member.name: M:Doli.DoPE10.DoPEmove.FDPoti(Doli.DoPE10.DoPE.CTRL,System.Double,Doli.DoPE10.DoPE.SENSOR,System.Int16,Doli.DoPE10.DoPE.EXT,System.Double,System.Int16@)
member.summary: Move crosshead according to an external command signal generated by a digital encoder (DigiPoti).
member.param: Speed offset for speed controlled modes
Sensor Number for the external command input. Use Sensor number 4 (SENSOR_D) for Digital Encoder (DigiPoti) on EDC frontpanel.
Dead area of encoder. The Encoder has to change the specified number of digits before the command is active. For EDC frontpanel DigiPoti 2 or 3 is a good value.
various position or speed control modes

For DoPE.EXT.POSITION Number of Units per revolution eg. Scale = 1 -> 1 mm per revolution, Scale = 10 -> 10 N per revolution For DoPE.EXT.SPEED_xx Number of revolutions to nominal speed eg. Scale = 2 -> after 2 revolutions to nominal speed
member.remarks: This is a special version of the DoPEExt2Ctrl command. Offsets and limits are handled inside this function. This command works not properly when DoPEConfPeekValue or one of the DoPEConfCMc commands are used.

member.param: false, Parameter for new cycle true, Modify Parameter of active cycles
false, Offset, and Destination absolute true, Offset, and Destination relative
Speed to final destination (0=automatic speed calculation)

member.name: M:Doli.DoPE10.DoPEmove.OffsC(System.Double,System.Double,System.Int16@)
member.summary: Special moving command to measure the offset of an external, analogue speed controller. This offset will be used for the speed output signal and compensates the offset of the external speed controller.

member.name: M:Doli.DoPE10.DoPEmove.DefaultAcc(Doli.DoPE10.DoPE.CTRL,System.Double)
member.summary: Set default acceleration (and deceleration) for all moving commands. After initialization default and nominal acceleration are identical.

member.name: M:Doli.DoPE10.DoPEmove.EmergencyMove(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Activate / deactivate emergency movement. Emergency movement is used to move crosshead if the hardware limit switch is active. (Not supported on EDC5/25)
member.param: true, activate false, deactivate emergency movement

member.name: M:Doli.DoPE10.DoPEmove.EmergencyOff(System.Boolean)
member.param: true, activate emergency off false, deactivate emergency off

member.name: M:Doli.DoPE10.DoPEopen.OpenAll(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.Collections.Generic.List{Doli.DoPE10.Edc}@)
member.summary: Open all available DoPE links and fill the open link info table.
member.param: Number of requested receiver buffers for messages. This number of messages can be stored inside DoPE until they are read with DoPE.GetMsg function.
Number of requested transmitter buffers for messages. This number of messages can be stored inside DoPE. They will be transmitted by DoPE to the EDC.
Number of requested data buffers. The measuring data record will be stored inside DoPE in a circular buffer. If data are not read with DoPEGetData the oldest record will be overwritten!
Number of entries that can be stored to the info table.
Pointer to storage for the number of valid entries in the info table.
member.remarks: All communication ports are scanned, starting with DoPEPORT_USB. All LAN ports without installed TCP/IP protocol are included to the scan.

member.returns: Info table with all DoPE handles set to IntPtr.Zero
